result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob H. Allred

records.addlTxt: 11:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court for Jacob H. Allred.  Atty Campbell has not had contact with DE.  Court notes mail has been returned.  State requests bond be forfeited.  Based on DE's non-appearance, Court forfeits bond.l

02:11 PM Defendant Jacob H. Allred not in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant.  JT is canceled.  Any cash bond would begin forfeiture.
Final pre-trial on April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:40 AM Attorney Shunette Torna Campbell in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states cases and appearances.  Court notes this was reset from 1pm today to 9:30 this morning a couple of days ago.  Atty Campbell notes issues w/contact w/the DE and he may not be aware of the change of court time.  Notes that the DE's phone is not working and his contact person (his father) hasn't seen him in a week.  This was reset at the request of Atty Campbell due to a scheduling conflict.  Court has issue w/issuing warrant due to possible issue w/DE being aware of today's date/time.  Atty Campbell thinks DE wanted to negotiate for a better plea offer but doesn't think they will push for the JT to proceed.  State has no objection to a warrant being issued but stayed until 1pm today.  Court will hold off until 1pm today to authorize warrants.  If DE shows up at 1pm today then the FPT will be reset to some time prior to 5/17 JT date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Final pre-trial on April 22, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 22, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Jury trial on May 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

01:17 PM Defendant Jacob H. Allred in court with attorney Shunette Torna Campbell.  C. Remington McConnell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.
No presence at the residence or the area around the residence of 235 S. Grove St., Reedsburg
Return date on February 15, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Pre-trial conference on January 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Return date on February 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:40 PM Defendant Jacob H. Allred by Zoom audio and video from LEC with attorney Annie E Getsinger by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant Jacob H. Allred in custody.  Natalia J Gess appeared for the State of Wisconsin in person and by Zoom audio and video.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised rights to an attorney.  Atty Getsinger believes DE qualifies for public defender representation but does not have clarification from her office yet.  File set for pre-trial conference/return date.  State recommends a $250 cash bond.  Atty Getsinger recommends a signature bond.  $50.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No presence at the residence or the area around the residence of 235 S. Grove Street, Reedsburg, WI  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 21, 2022 at 11:30 am.  Return date scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
